title: 'Good quality but heavy'
body: The quality of the box is good. It is smooth and easy to open and close each tray. The only issue I have is it is quite heavy as I feared. When loaded with tools, it is a strain on your muscles to carry it around. It is definitely better than the plastic tool boxes which don't offer these multiple swing-out trays which allows uncluttered storage. If it were available in some light-weight material it would be perfect.

title: 'Sturdy box. Gets the job done'
body: The quality of the product is good and it is very well thought out. It never opens accidentally if you are carrying it by handle. Closes with ease and closes with the handles. If you want to stack it, handles fall side way and you can stack stuff on top of it when kept in storages. Definitely it's costly than alternative. But it's worth all penny.

title: 'Critical Review'
body: Without a doubt it is an outstanding piece of tool box... It's built quality is 5 star and its paint quality is 5 star. Shipping and packaging was above average too!  But I will be doing a critical and in depth review pointing at everything else that could be done better. Because, at almost twice the price of its competitors tool boxes. This better standout well above the others...  1. So my first complaint, definitely overpriced. 2. The steel hinges on the side are not painted, although they look great I am worried they might start to rust early due to the conditions of the tool box usage. 3. They could have provided a safety lock or latch mechanism, instead there is a crude hole at the top to shove a padlock and lock it. 4. For all the massive size... The space inside is still quite restrictive. Like you can fit an impact drill but not with its accessories box... Or if you own both an impact drill and a dremel drill. You need to choose between the two... Both cannot fit in together.  Hope this was helpful.
